intro: Prestonia gaudichaudii, commonly known as the Guianan prestonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
